pullrequest.title: Increased performance of dataframe to dict

content.raw:
Oh, very nice. There seems to be no downside to this so I'll merge.

By the way, if you are wanting to optimise further, I made a wrapper around some Python profiling tools that is particularly good for profiling individual functions - you can for example decorate just the `DataFrameModel.update_row()` method with the profiler and it will accumulate statistics about just this function, without being affected by all the time that lyse is idle. So it's particularly good for profiling GUI callbacks (I originally made it to profile why runmanager was slow for some operations). You can find this profiling tool [here](http://labscriptsuite.readthedocs.io/projects/bprofile/en/latest/).

Oh, very nice. There seems to be no downside to this so I'll merge.

By the way, if you are wanting to optimise further, I made a wrapper around some Python profiling tools that is particularly good for profiling individual functions - you can for example decorate just the DataFrameModel.update_row() method with the profiler and it will accumulate statistics about just this function, without being affected by all the time that lyse is idle. So it's particularly good for profiling GUI callbacks (I originally made it to profile why runmanager was slow for some operations). You can find this profiling tool here.
